name: Éditeur de médias sociaux multi-plateformes avec Airtable, Google Drive et Postiz
description:
## 📝 FLUX DE TÉLÉVERSEMENT DES MÉDIAS POSTIZ
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

🎯 OBJECTIF :
Pipeline de téléversement de médias automatisé qui télécharge des vidéos et des images depuis Google Drive et les téléverse dans le stockage Postiz pour la publication sur les réseaux sociaux.

🔄 PROCESSUS DE FLUX DE TRAVAIL :
1. Le webhook déclenche le flux de travail
2. Récupérer les métadonnées des médias depuis Airtable
3. Télécharger la vidéo + l'image depuis Google Drive
4. Téléverser les deux fichiers dans le stockage Postiz
5. Enregistrer les chemins de fichiers Postiz dans Airtable

🔧 DÉTAILS TECHNIQUES :
• API : point de terminaison Postiz /upload (multipart-form-data)
• Stockage : Convertit les fichiers Google Drive → URLs Postiz
• Intégration : Met à jour Airtable avec les chemins Postiz
• Requis : Tous les médias doivent être téléversés avant la publication

## 📱 FLUX DE PUBLICATION SUR LES RÉSEAUX SOCIAUX
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

🎯 OBJECTIF :
Publication automatisée sur plusieurs plateformes de réseaux sociaux utilisant l'API Postiz. Distribue le contenu sur Instagram, Twitter/X (2 comptes), LinkedIn et Facebook avec nettoyage et formatage de contenu spécifiques à chaque plateforme.

🔄 PROCESSUS COMPLET DU FLUX DE TRAVAIL :
1. 📊 Récupérer le contenu des réseaux sociaux depuis la base de données Airtable
2. 🔗 Obtenir les IDs d'intégration pour toutes les plateformes sociales connectées
3. 🔀 Acheminer chaque plateforme vers le processeur de contenu approprié
4. 🧹 Nettoyer le contenu pour éviter les erreurs de formatage JSON
5. 📱 Publier simultanément sur les plateformes de réseaux sociaux respectives

📋 COUVERTURE DES PLATEFORMES :
• 📸 Instagram (Contenu visuel + légendes)
• 🐦 Compte principal Twitter/X (Texte + images)
• 🐦 Compte alternatif Twitter/X (Publication en double)
• 💼 LinkedIn (Contenu professionnel)
• 📘 Facebook (Publication dans l'écosystème Meta)

⚠️ NETTOYAGE CRITIQUE DU CONTENU :
• Supprime les sauts de ligne (\n), les retours chariot (\r), les tabulations (\t)
• Remplace plusieurs espaces par un espace unique
• Empêche les erreurs 'le paramètre JSON doit être un JSON valide'
• ESSENTIEL : Sans nettoyage, tous les appels API échouent !

🔧 SPÉCIFICATIONS TECHNIQUES :
• API : point de terminaison Postiz /posts (POST)
• Authentification : Authentification par en-tête HTTP
• Content-Type : application/json
• Type de publication : Immédiat ('maintenant') + délai d'une minute
• Médias : Références aux chemins d'images Postiz pré-téléversés
• Limite de taux : 30 requêtes/heure (limitation bêta de l'API)

🔗 SOURCES DE DONNÉES :
• Contenu : Airtable 
• Médias : Pré-téléversés via un flux de travail de téléversement de médias séparé
• Champs : instagram_caption, linkedin_post, twitter single, faceboook
• Images : Références aux chemins de champ 'image postiz'

⚡ FLUX D'EXÉCUTION :
Airtable → Intégrations → Routeur de plateforme → Nettoyeurs de contenu → Éditeurs sociaux

🚨 DÉPANNAGE :
• Erreurs JSON : Vérifiez les nœuds de nettoyage de contenu
• Erreurs 500 : Vérifiez les IDs d'intégration et les connexions de compte
• Médias manquants : Assurez-vous que le flux de travail de téléversement de médias a été exécuté en premier
• Limites de taux : Échelonner les exécutions (limite de 30/heure)

🔄 DÉPENDANCES :
• Requis : Flux de travail de téléversement de médias (pour les chemins d'images/vidéos)
• Se connecte à : Flux de travail d'analyse et de surveillance
• Met à jour : Airtable avec le statut de publication et les URLs

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━






⚠️ NOTES CRITIQUES :
• Ne peut pas utiliser d'URLs externes dans les publications Postiz
• Les fichiers doivent être téléversés sur Google Drive d'abord - ID référencé dans Airtable
• Permet le suivi des références pour toutes les plateformes

📊 FLUX DE DONNÉES :
Google Drive → Télécharger → Téléversement Postiz → Mise à jour Airtable

🔗 SE CONNECTE À :
Flux de publication principaux sur les réseaux sociaux qui référencent ces chemins de fichiers téléversés pour la publication sur Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook et YouTube.
## 🎬 FLUX DE PUBLICATION DE VIDÉO
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

🎯 OBJECTIF :
Distribution automatisée de contenu vidéo sur Instagram, Facebook et YouTube utilisant l'API Postiz. Flux de travail spécialisé pour le contenu vidéo avec traitement et nettoyage spécifiques à chaque plateforme.

🔄 EXÉCUTION DU FLUX DE TRAVAIL :
1. 📊 Récupérer le contenu vidéo depuis la base de données Airtable (recuoYjg4icStHsMK)
2. 🔗 Obtenir les IDs d'intégration pour les plateformes activées pour la vidéo
3. 🔀 Acheminer les plateformes vers les processeurs vidéo appropriés
4. 🧹 Nettoyer le contenu pour Instagram & Facebook (YouTube contourné)
5. 📹 Publier simultanément sur les plateformes vidéo

📹 COUVERTURE DES PLATEFORMES :
• 📱 Instagram : Publications vidéo & Reels (✅ Fonctionne)
• 📘 Facebook : Contenu vidéo (⚠️ Mode test)
• 🎬 YouTube : Vidéos longues (🚨 Cassé)

⚡ FLUX D'EXÉCUTION :
Airtable → Intégrations → Routeur vidéo → [3 Chemins parallèles]
├── Instagram : Nettoyeur → Éditeur
├── Facebook : Nettoyeur → Éditeur  
└── YouTube : [Direct] → Éditeur

🗄️ SOURCE DE DONNÉES :
• Base : Netkreatives.com 
• Table : Outil Youtube 
• Champ Vidéo : 'postiz video'
• Champs de contenu : instagram_caption, faceboook


🔧 SPÉCIFICATIONS TECHNIQUES :
• Méthode : POST
• Auth : En-tête HTTP (identifiants Postiz)
• Timing : Publication immédiate (+1 minute de délai)
• Médias : Chemins vidéo pré-téléversés
• Content-Type : application/json

nodes.name: 📊 Content Database (Media)
nodes.notes:
📋 Fetches media and content from Airtable
• Table: Youtube tool (tblRnaXqxrvcQhqBw)
• Record: recuoYjg4icStHsMK
• Contains: Video/image file IDs, social content
• Fields: Short form Video, Image for socials
🔗 Feeds into media download and upload pipeline

nodes.name: 📹 Video Upload to Postiz
nodes.notes:
🔄 Uploads video files to Postiz storage
• Endpoint: POST /upload
• Content-Type: multipart-form-data
• Input: Binary video data from Google Drive
• Output: Postiz file ID and path
• Required: Videos must be uploaded before posting
⚠️ Cannot use external URLs in Postiz posts

nodes.name: 💾 Save Video Path
nodes.notes:
🔄 Updates Airtable with Postiz video path
• Operation: Update record
• Field: 'postiz video' = upload response path
• Maintains data consistency across systems
• Enables future reference to uploaded videos
📝 Links Google Drive → Postiz → Airtable chain

nodes.name: 🖼️ Image Upload to Postiz
nodes.notes:
🔄 Uploads image files to Postiz storage
• Endpoint: POST /upload
• Content-Type: multipart-form-data
• Input: Binary image data from Google Drive
• Output: Postiz file ID and path for posts
• Supports: JPG, PNG, GIF formats
📱 Used across Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook

nodes.name: 💾 Save Image Path
nodes.notes:
🔄 Updates Airtable with Postiz image path
• Operation: Update record
• Field: 'postiz image' = upload response path
• Used by all image-based social posts
• Maintains referential integrity
📊 Enables tracking of media usage across platforms

nodes.name: 📥 Download Video from Drive
nodes.notes:
☁️ Downloads video from Google Drive
• Input: Google Drive file ID from Airtable
• Field: 'Short form Video'
• Output: Binary video data
• Formats: MP4, MOV, AVI supported
🔗 Feeds directly into Postiz upload pipeline

nodes.name: 📥 Download Image from Drive
nodes.notes:
☁️ Downloads image from Google Drive
• Input: Google Drive file ID from Airtable
• Field: 'Image for socials'
• Output: Binary image data
• Used across all visual social platforms
📱 Optimized for social media dimensions

parameters.content:
## 📝 POSTIZ MEDIA UPLOAD WORKFLOW
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

🎯 PURPOSE:
Automated media upload pipeline that downloads videos and images from Google Drive and uploads them to Postiz storage for social media posting.

🔄 WORKFLOW PROCESS:
1. Webhook triggers the workflow
2. Fetch media metadata from Airtable
3. Download video + image from Google Drive
4. Upload both files to Postiz storage
5. Save Postiz file paths back to Airtable

🔧 TECHNICAL DETAILS:
• API: Postiz /upload endpoint (multipart-form-data)
• Storage: Converts Google Drive files → Postiz URLs
• Integration: Updates Airtable with Postiz paths
• Required: All media must be uploaded before posting








⚠️ CRITICAL NOTES:
• Cannot use external URLs in Postiz posts
• Files must be uploaded to google drive first - id referenced in airtable
• Enables reference tracking for all platforms

📊 DATA FLOW:
Google Drive → Download → Postiz Upload → Airtable Update

🔗 CONNECTS TO:
Main social media posting workflows that reference these uploaded file paths for Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, and YouTube posting.

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

nodes.name: 🔗 integrations
nodes.notes:
📋 Fetches all connected social media integrations from Postiz
• Gets integration IDs for Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.
• Required for platform-specific posting
• Returns: id, name, identifier, disabled status

nodes.name: 🔀 Platform Router
nodes.notes:
🎯 Routes integrations to appropriate posting workflows
• Instagram: cmcotolny0001pnal2i86mkrh
• Twitter Alt: cmcg6ifpn001hmx9gakul0358
• Twitter Main: cmcf026ts0001mx9g6o8t5xc4
• LinkedIn: linkedin-page identifier
• Facebook: facebook identifier
• YouTube: youtube identifier
⚠️ Integration IDs are unique per Postiz installation

nodes.name: 🐦 X/Twitter Posts
nodes.notes:
📱 Posts to Twitter/X using Postiz API
• Uses cleaned 'twitter single' content from Airtable
• Includes image from 'postiz image' field
• Posts immediately (type: 'now')
• Settings: type='post' for regular tweets
💡 Content must be cleaned to prevent JSON errors

nodes.name: 💼 LinkedIn Publisher
nodes.notes:
📊 Posts professional content to LinkedIn
• Uses cleaned 'linkedin_post' content (processed by Code2)
• Targets LinkedIn Pages (business accounts)
• Professional formatting and tone
• Image support for visual content
✅ Content cleaning prevents JSON formatting errors

nodes.name: 🐦 X/Twitter Alt Account
nodes.notes:
📱 Alternative Twitter/X account posting
• Duplicate of main Twitter posting for secondary account
• Uses same 'twitter single' content
• Different integration ID for alt account
• Maintains consistency across multiple X accounts
🔄 Part of multi-account social strategy

nodes.name: 🧹 Instagram Content Cleaner
nodes.notes:
⚠️ CRITICAL: Fixes JSON formatting issues
• Removes line breaks (\n), carriage returns (\r), tabs (\t)
• Replaces multiple spaces with single spaces
• Prevents 'JSON parameter needs to be valid JSON' errors
• Essential for Instagram caption processing
🚫 Without this: API calls fail with malformed JSON

nodes.name: 📸 Instagram Publisher
nodes.notes:
📱 Posts visual content to Instagram
• Uses cleaned 'instagram_caption' (processed by Code1)
• Requires image for all Instagram posts
• Tags: 'instagram' for tracking
• Settings: type='post' for feed posts
✅ Working configuration with proper content cleaning

nodes.name: 📊 Content Database (Posts)
nodes.notes:
📋 Fetches social media content from Airtable
• Same table/record as media source
• Contains: platform-specific post content
• Fields: instagram_caption, linkedin_post, twitter single, faceboook
• Feeds content into cleaning and posting workflows
🔄 Central content repository for all platforms

nodes.name: 🧹 LinkedIn Content Cleaner
nodes.notes:
⚠️ CRITICAL: Fixes JSON formatting for LinkedIn
• Same cleaning logic as Instagram cleaner
• Removes problematic characters: \n, \r, \t
• Prevents API failures with malformed JSON
• Essential for LinkedIn professional content
💼 Maintains professional formatting while ensuring JSON validity

nodes.name: 📘 Facebook Publisher
nodes.notes:
📱 Posts content to Facebook
• Uses cleaned 'faceboook' content (processed by Code3)
• Supports both images and videos
• Similar functionality to Instagram
• Settings: type='post' for feed posts
🔵 Part of Meta ecosystem alongside Instagram

nodes.name: 🧹 Facebook Content Cleaner
nodes.notes:
⚠️ CRITICAL: Fixes JSON formatting for Facebook
• Cleans 'faceboook' field from Airtable
• Same regex patterns as other cleaners
• Prevents JSON parsing errors in API calls
• Essential for Facebook posting reliability
📘 Part of Meta content processing pipeline

parameters.content:
## 📱 SOCIAL MEDIA POSTING WORKFLOW
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

🎯 PURPOSE:
Automated multi-platform social media posting using Postiz API. Distributes content across Instagram, Twitter/X (2 accounts), LinkedIn, and Facebook with platform-specific content cleaning and formatting.

🔄 COMPLETE WORKFLOW PROCESS:
1. 📊 Fetch social media content from Airtable database
2. 🔗 Get integration IDs for all connected social platforms
3. 🔀 Route each platform to appropriate content processor
4. 🧹 Clean content to prevent JSON formatting errors
5. 📱 Post to respective social media platforms simultaneously

📋 PLATFORM COVERAGE:
• 📸 Instagram (Visual content + captions)
• 🐦 Twitter/X Main Account (Text + images)
• 🐦 Twitter/X Alt Account (Duplicate posting)
• 💼 LinkedIn (Professional content)
• 📘 Facebook (Meta ecosystem posting)

⚠️ CRITICAL CONTENT CLEANING:
• Removes line breaks (\n), carriage returns (\r), tabs (\t)
• Replaces multiple spaces with single spaces
• Prevents 'JSON parameter needs to be valid JSON' errors
• ESSENTIAL: Without cleaning, all API calls fail!

🔧 TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS:
• API: Postiz /posts endpoint (POST)
• Authentication: HTTP Header Auth
• Content-Type: application/json
• Posting Type: Immediate ('now') + 1 minute delay
• Media: References pre-uploaded Postiz image paths
• Rate Limit: 30 requests/hour (API beta limitation)

🔗 DATA SOURCES:
• Content: Airtable 
• Media: Pre-uploaded via separate media upload workflow
• Fields: instagram_caption, linkedin_post, twitter single, faceboook
• Images: References 'postiz image' field paths

⚡ EXECUTION FLOW:
Airtable → Integrations → Platform Router → Content Cleaners → Social Publishers

🚨 TROUBLESHOOTING:
• JSON Errors: Check content cleaning nodes
• 500 Errors: Verify integration IDs and account connections
• Missing Media: Ensure media upload workflow ran first
• Rate Limits: Space out executions (30/hour limit)

🔄 DEPENDENCIES:
• Requires: Media upload workflow (for image/video paths)
• Connects to: Analytics and monitoring workflows
• Updates: Airtable with posting status and URLs

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

nodes.name: 🎬 YouTube Publisher
nodes.notes:
📺 Posts content to YouTube (Note: Uses Facebook content)
• Currently using 'faceboook' content field
• Uses 'postiz image' instead of video
• May need adjustment for proper YouTube video posting
• YouTube typically requires video content, not images
⚠️ Configuration may need refinement for YouTube specifics

nodes.name: 🧹 Facebook Video Cleaner
nodes.notes:
⚠️ CRITICAL: Content cleaner for Facebook videos
• Processes Facebook content for video posts
• References 'Airtable' node (video workflow)
• Same cleaning regex as other cleaners
• Prevents JSON formatting errors
📹 Part of Facebook video content pipeline

nodes.name: 📘 Facebook Video Publisher
nodes.notes:
📱 Posts video content to Facebook
• Uses Facebook content with '11111' test suffix
• References 'postiz video' for video content
• Part of Facebook video strategy
• Same API structure as other platforms
🎬 Facebook video content distribution

nodes.name: 📊 Content Database (Video)
nodes.notes:
📋 Content source for video workflow
• Same table/record as other Airtable nodes
• Provides content for video-based posts
• Contains uploaded video paths ('postiz video')
• Feeds into video content processing
🎬 Specialized for video content distribution

nodes.name: 📹 Instagram Video Publisher
nodes.notes:
📱 Posts video content to Instagram
• Uses cleaned caption from video cleaner
• References 'postiz video' field (uploaded video)
• Can be used for Reels or regular video posts
• Same structure as image posts but with video
🎬 Supports Instagram's video content strategy

nodes.name: 🧹 Instagram Video Cleaner
nodes.notes:
⚠️ CRITICAL: Content cleaner for video workflow
• Same cleaning logic as image workflow
• Processes Instagram captions for video posts
• References different Airtable node ('Airtable' vs 'Airtable2')
• Prevents JSON errors in video posting
📹 Part of video-specific content pipeline

nodes.name: 🔀 Video Platform Router
nodes.notes:
🎯 Routes video-based content to platforms
• Instagram: For video posts and reels
• Facebook: For video content
• YouTube: For long-form video uploads
• Simplified routing for video workflow
📹 Specialized for video content distribution

nodes.name: 🔗 integrations (Branch 2)
nodes.notes:
📋 Secondary integrations fetch for video workflow
• Duplicate of main integrations node
• Supports video-based posting workflow
• Gets platform IDs for Instagram/Facebook video posts
• Enables parallel processing of different content types

parameters.content:
## 🎬 VIDEO POSTING WORKFLOW
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

🎯 PURPOSE:
Automated video content distribution across Instagram, Facebook, and YouTube using Postiz API. Specialized workflow for video content with platform-specific processing and cleaning.

🔄 WORKFLOW EXECUTION:
1. 📊 Fetch video content from Airtable database (recuoYjg4icStHsMK)
2. 🔗 Get integration IDs for video-enabled platforms
3. 🔀 Route platforms to appropriate video processors
4. 🧹 Clean content for Instagram & Facebook (YouTube bypassed)
5. 📹 Publish to video platforms simultaneously

📹 PLATFORM COVERAGE:
• 📱 Instagram: Video posts & Reels (✅ Working)
• 📘 Facebook: Video content (⚠️ Test mode)
• 🎬 YouTube: Long-form videos (🚨 Broken)

⚡ EXECUTION FLOW:
Airtable → Integrations → Video Router → [3 Parallel Paths]
├── Instagram: Cleaner → Publisher
├── Facebook: Cleaner → Publisher  
└── YouTube: [Direct] → Publisher

🗄️ DATA SOURCE:
• Base: Netkreatives.com 
• Table: Youtube tool 
• Video Field: 'postiz video'
• Content Fields: instagram_caption, faceboook


🔧 TECHNICAL SPECS:
• Method: POST
• Auth: HTTP Header (Postiz credentials)
• Timing: Immediate posting (+1 minute delay)
• Media: Pre-uploaded video paths
• Content-Type: application/json

nodes.name: 🔍 Content Validator & Cleaner1
nodes.notes:
✅ Comprehensive validation and cleaning
• Validates content for all platforms
• Character limit enforcement
• JSON-safe content cleaning
• Media availability checks
• Error and warning collection

nodes.name: 📋 Content Availability Check1
nodes.notes:
🔍 Validates processed content
• Ensures content exists for posting
• Checks for critical validation errors
• Routes to error handling if needed
• Prevents unnecessary API calls

nodes.name: ❌ Content Error1
nodes.notes:
🚫 Handles missing/invalid content
• Detailed validation results
• Platform-specific feedback
• Record identification
• Debugging information

parameters.errorMessage: No valid content found for posting

nodes.name: 🎯 Upload
nodes.notes:
🚀 Entry point for social media automation
• Webhook URL: /webhook/328d95ae-3de0-41bf-a8bf-52071bdb36d3
• Triggers entire posting workflow
• Can be called from external systems
• Starts both media upload and content posting processes

nodes.name: 📊 Fixed Results Processor
nodes.notes:
📈 FIXED: Now correctly maps integration IDs to platforms
• Uses your exact integration IDs from Switch node
• Detects success via postId field
• Tracks all platforms correctly
• No more 'undefined' platforms!

nodes.name: 🖼️ Image Upload to Postiz2
nodes.notes:
🔄 Uploads image files to Postiz storage
• Endpoint: POST /upload
• Content-Type: multipart-form-data
• Input: Binary image data from Google Drive
• Output: Postiz file ID and path for posts
• Supports: JPG, PNG, GIF formats
📱 Used across Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook

nodes.name: 💾 Save Image Path1
nodes.notes:
🔄 Updates Airtable with Postiz image path
• Operation: Update record
• Field: 'postiz image' = upload response path
• Used by all image-based social posts
• Maintains referential integrity
📊 Enables tracking of media usage across platforms

nodes.name: 📥 Download x image from Drive
nodes.notes:
☁️ Downloads image from Google Drive
• Input: Google Drive file ID from Airtable
• Field: 'Image for socials'
• Output: Binary image data
• Used across all visual social platforms
📱 Optimized for social media dimensions

user.name: Kurt Bijl
user.bio: I believe AI is a force multiplier — but only if you know how to use it. I create high-quality, easy-to-follow content for people like me: driven, curious, and ready to build.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
